response.answer_text: To put it simply~ YouTube shouldn’t be banned. Period. To start me off, YouTube already isn’t banned at my school. How do they keep track of us then? Well, i wish i could say that they don’t have to. Our school’s Security system, Smoothwall, Looks for keywords and then blocks those URLS. It also blocks URLS the Administration puts in manually. This even works in YouTube and the way the URLS look. Not only that (i don’t know how they do this) But the school blocks certain videos and comments, even on my personal email account. So the proof is there. You can have YouTube unblocked and still restrict access from videos you don’t want them to see. Hear that schools? Get to unblocking! Have a good day, mate!
